modules.description: Calculates the terminal display width of a string, accounting for wide characters like CJK and emoji using a minimal reimplementation of the wcwidth algorithm. It processes UTF-8 encoded strings and returns the number of columns they occupy. The API includes functions to compute the width of a single code point, a string, and a list of code points.

Converts strings to lists of Unicode characters and calculates their display width, returning -1 for unprintable characters. Handles multi-byte UTF-8 sequences and ensures accurate width computation for terminal rendering. Processes input strings to determine total width, excluding newline characters.
